summary: HTML5 extern doesn't include new history events

comments.content: The HTML5 history definitions starting at <http://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/source/browse/trunk/externs/html5.js#1171> don't include the new history events defined at <http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/history.html#event-definitions>. The attached patch adds those new events to the extern.
Care to start a code review on http://codereview.appspot.com/ ?

http://codereview.appspot.com/2794041/

Going forward, should contributors assign a default reviewer to each case or just create it without a reviewer and post the link here?

Actually, hold up a day or so on this review. I'm waiting on a resolution to <http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=11163> for one of the properties to these events. I'd also like to add the event initialization functions.

The bug against the spec is still open and so I implemented the externs exactly as the spec says. I'm CC'd on the bug and will open a new patch if anything changes.

Attaching revised patch to reflect event initializations and the possible spec bug.
The code review has been updated with the new patch.
The code review has been updated again to fix some bad annotations.
This issue was closed by revision r675.
